main.name: Tyler Hansen
main.bio: Hi, I'm Tyler. I'm a rising junior at Colby College who likes to write code. I love all things STEM and I'm double majoring in Computer Science and Physics. Aside from my academic endeavors, I am a fan of all things Sci-Fi, an exceptionally average video game player, a part-time employee as an audiovisual technician, and a full-time consumer of coffee.
main.contactmessage: Want to reach out? Please shoot me an email or reach out to me on one of the social media platforms linked below. Alternatively, if you require my attention via snail mail:

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Pursuing a double major with a minor in mathematics. Maintaining a 3.90 overall GPA, 4.0 in Computer Science and 3.90 in Physics. Serving as Publicity Chair and Board Member of the Colby Hackers and an active member of the Colby Engineering Society as well as the Innovation and Entrepeneurship Student Council. Relevant Coursework: CS251: Data Analysis and Visualization, CS232: Computer Organization, CS231: Data Structures and Algorithms, PH241-242: Modern Physics I & II, PH250: Experiments in Modern Physics
Graduated in top ten percent of class. Place third and second in the 2017 and 2018 Maine App Challenges. Served as the Lead Programmer for FIRST Robotics Competition Team 58.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Created a full-stack web application using React.js and a Django REST API backend written in Python to perform complex entrainment suitability analysis and intense metadata validation of certain audio files. Worked on both the front-end/UX employing Tailwind CSS & Material UI and the back-end writing algorithms. Collaborated remotely (due to COVID-19) on a team of multiple interns in an agile environment, using DevOps tools such as Git, Docker, Jira, etc. in a PR-focused workflow for rapid iteration and QA.
work.linkdesc: Here is a link to the patent that the algorithms adhered to.

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: Performed analysis of biometric data in Python, including parsing of nested JSON objects to human-readable CSV in a specific format, validating this conversion of file formats programmatically. This was followed by the synchronization and visualization of data collected in real-time and in post-processing, which required the identification of and correction for any missed measurements in real-time. Accepted Summer 2020 return offer.

work.title: Founder & CEO
work.description: My introduction to founding a startup, PieFolio was a portfolio website creation platform for busy college students that boiled the process down to form-based submission. Collected a waitlist of over 100 college students and performed extensive market research talking to 50+ parents of college students after competing in a pitch competition. Wrote an application for and received a grant from the Maine Technology Institute for $5,000.
work.linkdesc: Here is an article in MaineBiz that talks about PieFolio.

work.title: Software Development Intern
work.description: Learned what it's like to launch a startup and create software solutions to real-world problems. Created and optimized morning listening prototype based on students' needs after interviewing over 30 students, leading to a permanent feature. Developed and refined oboarding system to get listeners started. Reduced oboarding time from 5 minutes to 60 seconds from QR code to listening. Worked with company's two co-founders, 10 fellow interns, and more than 200 students to prioritize software development backlog.

projects.title: renaissance
projects.category: "renaissance" is an art installation I helped create for CS267, a course at Colby College. The audience approaches a blank canvas and a webcam snaps a photo of them. A neural style transfer is then performed on the image, and the user is "painted into" a famous work of art. Click to learn more.

projects.title: Maine App Challenge
projects.category: I finished third place in the 2017 Maine App Challenge, and second in 2018. In 2017, I created the SoPo Spark Project, a web app that connected to the Twitter API to inspire residents of my city to do community service and let them see others participate. In 2018, I developed STEMGirlz, a platformer game developed in the Unity Game Engine that introduces the user to famous women in STEM history.

projects.title: Meteor Math Madness
projects.category: A game that I built for my local elementary schools to help kids develop mental math skills. Created in the Unity Game Engine. Got feedback from teachers and improved accordingly. Click to play!
